sources.note: TheSNFist Suite landing page. Describes PacEHR as the first EHR designed for PALTC professionals. Lists product ecosystem: PacEHR, RCM, CCM services. Mentions streamlined documentation, patient census sorting, integrated billing.

Saisystems Health main page. Lists full product ecosystem: PacEHR, billEHR (charge capture), SNFConnect (communication), navigatEHR (dashboards), RCM, coding/billing, payor enrollment. Claims 10x documentation time reduction, AI-powered coding.
PacEHR product page. Describes it as EHR created by and for PALTC professionals. Page content was mostly CSS/structural — limited substantive detail extractable.
Practice support services page. Confirms integration with PointClickCare. Lists full managed services offering. Describes one-stop-shop positioning for PALTC providers.
Press release from May 2021 announcing PacEHR launch. Page content was mostly structural — limited text extractable beyond metadata.

Saisystems International parent company. Established 1987, Shelton CT. Two divisions: Saisystems Health (PALTC) and Saisystems Technology (IT consulting). Microsoft Azure Solutions Partner. Donates 25% of profit to charity.
EHI export documentation page. Page content was mostly CSS/structural — described as allowing manual one-time data exports. Will be reviewed in detail in Phase 2.

EIN Presswire press release from March 31, 2021. Michael Healey (VP Digital Health) quoted. Notes 30+ years LTPAC experience. PALTC practitioners are <5% of US medical professionals. Coding suggestions based on place of service.

FindEMR product listing. Lists features: speech recognition, pre-defined documentation elements, pre-populated past patient data, code recommendation, scheduling, e-prescriptions, patient portal, compliance tracking, document management, claims management. No user reviews posted.

SoftwareFinder listing. 4.8/5 stars from 4 reviews, 100% positive. Users include APRN and NP. Features: voice-to-text, customizable macros, auto-population, multi-patient access, billing/coding assistance. Custom pricing. Targets small-medium PALTC facilities.
Announcement that services are available in 39 states. Found via search but not visited in detail.
